description: The US Supreme Court’s handling of Donald Trump’s criminal immunity bid has cast new doubt over efforts to put the former president on trial for 2020 election interference before voters go to the polls again in November.
title: Here’s How the Supreme Court Can Doom Trump’s Jan. 6 Trial

description: The scandal engulfing the Georgia prosecution of Donald Trump by Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis doesn’t warrant her removal from the election-interference case, a prosecutor for the DA argued Friday to the judge overseeing a misconduct hearing.
title: Fani Willis Scandal Doesn’t Warrant Her Ouster, DA Lawyer Says

description: Lisa Murkowski of Alaska is backing Nikki Haley, delivering the long-shot Republican presidential contender her first endorsement from a sitting US senator days before voters hit the polls on Super Tuesday.
title: Haley Gets First Senate Endorsement From Alaska’s Murkowski

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden State of the Union Plans Confront a Standoff in Congress

description: An armed military guard at Taiwan’s Presidential Office killed himself while at his post Friday night, after which the office pledged to strengthen counseling services.
title: Taiwan Presidential Guard Shoots Himself; New Counseling Pledged

description: President Joe Biden announced the US would begin airdropping humanitarian aid into Gaza, joining other nations in a bid to relieve increasingly dire conditions wrought by the Israel-Hamas war.
title: Biden Says US to Airdrop Gaza Aid Amid Humanitarian Crisis

description: Billionaire Greg Flynn, who owns two dozen Panera Bread franchises in California, said he suggested excluding fast-casual restaurants from a bill raising minimum wages for fast-food workers in the state, but was surprised when chains that make and sell bread were specifically exempted from the final legislation.
title: Billionaire Flynn Says He Met Newsom Staff in Lobbying Effort Against Wage Bill

description: Rishi Sunak warned that Islamist and far-right extremists are undermining British democracy, as he urged police to take a tougher approach to the protest marches since the Israel-Hamas war.
title: Sunak Vows UK Crackdown on Protests Over Gaza After Galloway Win

description: The World Trade Organization tentatively agreed to extend a moratorium on e-commerce tariffs after marathon negotiations in Abu Dhabi, with other key trade issues including subsidies on agriculture and fisheries still unresolved.
title: WTO Set to Extend Moratorium on E-Commerce Tariffs for Two Years

description: A federal judge in Florida indicated Donald Trump’s trial for mishandling classified documents will likely be postponed from the current May 20 start date, putting his legal schedule in limbo as he campaigns again for the White House.
title: Trump’s Florida Trial on Secret Records Will Likely Be Postponed

description: A businessman pleaded guilty to conspiring to bribe US Senator Bob Menendez, saying he gave a Mercedes Benz to the New Jersey Democrat in exchange for favors. He became the first defendant charged with the lawmaker to admit his role in a sprawling corruption case.
title: Businessman Tells Judge He Bribed Senator Menendez for Favors

description: Ukraine’s military is set to receive first of what may be hundreds of thousands of 155mm artillery shells as part of an international effort to forage allied stockpiles as US efforts to send more aid get hung up in Congress.
title: Ukraine to Get 155mm Artillery Shells Found in Czech-Led Effort

description: Democratic Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro said the Biden administration’s recent halt in liquefied natural gas export licenses should be limited in time, stopping short of outright criticizing a pause that could undermine job creation in a state that’s relying on energy to drive growth.
title: Pennsylvania Governor Urges Biden to Keep Natural Gas Export Pause Limited

description: President Joe Biden’s ambassador to Singapore threatened staff, wasted money and poorly promoted US interests, according to an internal watchdog report released Friday.
title: US Envoy to Singapore Berated Staff, Wasted Money, Watchdog Says

description: The Netherlands has earmarked several billion euros to replace most of its large surface ships over the next 15 years, as the country seeks to boost its military capacity in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: Netherlands to Spend Billions on Ships to Boost Defense Capacity

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte met in Kharkiv in northeastern Ukraine to sign a bilateral security agreement.
title: Ukraine Signs Long-Term Security Agreement With Netherlands

description: Hungary managed to unblock about €2 billion ($2.2 billion) in European Union funds as Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s government made further progress in the recovery of crucial financing.
title: EU Unblocks About €2 Billion From Suspended Funding for Hungary

description: Mexico kicked off its official presidential campaign season Friday, with leading candidates taking center stage as popular outgoing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s overwhelming influence hangs over the country’s future.
title: AMLO’s Influence Looms Over Kickoff of Mexico Campaign to Replace Him

description: Nikki Haley lamented the direction of the Republican Party — claiming it has abandoned its core principles of small government and free markets — with rival Donald Trump on the cusp of clinching the nomination.
title: Haley Criticizes GOP Priorities as Trump Closes In on Nomination

description: The IDF’s account alone shows cease-fire and greater media access needed.
title: Gaza's Aid Convoy 'Massacre' Shows How Desperately We Need a Cease-Fire

description: Germany’s ruling coalition is stitching together a package of measures likely worth around €7 billion ($7.6 billion) to try to lift Europe’s largest economy out of a prolonged slump, according to people familiar with the planning.
title: Germany Preparing €7 Billion Tax Package to Jump-Start Growth

description: The price tag for the promises Vladimir Putin has made ahead of Russian presidential elections later this month will total tens of billions of dollars over the next six years.
title: Putin’s Pre-Election Promises May Cost Russia $130 Billion

description: Left-wing serial disrupter George Galloway’s return to Parliament throws more volatility into the already febrile mix in British politics, as the Israel-Hamas war upends community cohesion and parties grapple for a stance on the conflict that doesn’t alienate supporters.
title: George Galloway’s Comeback Tests UK’s Febrile Politics Over War in Gaza

description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Friday lavished praise on Chile during a visit aimed at strengthening ties with an ally whose critical minerals are key to weaning dependence off China.
title: Yellen Praises Chile’s Policies in Visit to Lithium-Rich Ally

description: South Africa’s state power utility needs to simplify its convoluted management structure, which is stifling output from its plants and contributing to 152 billion rand ($7.9 billion) in annual losses due to unavailable generation capacity, a consultants’ investigation found.
title: Simpler Eskom Structure Would End $8 Billion Leak, Probe Finds

description: Italian Finance Minister Giancarlo Giorgetti expressed his concern at what he sees as the European Union holding up the sale of a stake in carrier ITA Airways, a key part of his government’s attempt to meet a €20 billion ($21.8 billion) privatization target.
title: Italy’s Giorgetti Is Worried About EU Hold Up of ITA Stake Sale

description: More than a decade ago, Thomas Jordan, who is calling time on his period as president of the Swiss National Bank, was drafted in to bring stability to an institution in turmoil. While at times following Mervyn King’s mantra to make central banking “boring,” his tenure was marked by moments of high drama that shook both global currency and banking markets.
title: Thomas Jordan’s Big Moments: Global Franc Shock to Credit Suisse Rescue

description: Kenya and Haiti signed a pact that will enable the East African nation to send 1,000 police officers to the island as part of a bid by donors to stop the country’s slide deeper into lawlessness.
title: Kenya, Haiti Sign Pact to Send 1,000 Kenya Police to Island

description: Lenders to TotalEnergies SE’s Mozambique liquefied natural gas project are weighing the release of billions of dollars in funding as the company plans to resume construction three years after development was halted by Islamist insurgent attacks.
title: Total Funders Weigh Mozambique Gas Restart After Three-Year Halt

description: One of Switzerland’s most consequential public appointments in a generation will take place this year with the selection of a central bank chief for one of the world’s key currencies.
title: The Frontrunners to Replace Swiss National Bank President Thomas Jordan

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Endless Agony for World’s Most Polluted Place

description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said any plan to seize or monetize some $282 billion in frozen Russian assets to help Ukraine cannot be viewed as a replacement for urgently needed assistance for the embattled country that’s been held up in Congress.
title: Yellen Says Russian Assets ‘No Substitute’ for US Aid to Ukraine

description: Britain’s politicians are homing in on benefits that have long been offered to some of the nation’s richest residents, weighing whether a tax sting on the upper echelons will help boost them in the polls.
title: World’s Rich Caught in Crossfire of Britain’s Election Battle

description: President Joe Biden will advocate plans to increase taxes on the wealthy and corporations as well as to lower prescription drug prices in his State of the Union address next week, in what aides describe as an effort to lay out second term proposals for protecting and implementing his economic agenda.
title: Biden Will Push Higher Taxes for the Rich in State of the Union

description: Europe is set to end the heating season with so much gas that the idea of storing more fuel in Ukraine to avoid a price crash is becoming attractive, despite the security risks of such a move.
title: Europe Awash With Gas Is Set to Rely More on Ukraine for Storage

description: Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates joined a growing wave of condemnation of Israel after dozens of Palestinians were killed and injured on Thursday in an outbreak of violence in Gaza.
title: Saudi Arabia, UAE Join Condemnation of Israel After Gaza Deaths

description: Zimbabwe needs to adopt a free-floating exchange rate and regularize the role of the central bank to get back on the path toward macroeconomic stability, the World Bank said.
title: Zimbabwe Needs Currency, Central Bank Reforms, World Bank Says

description: The cost of hoping for the best could be huge for the West.
title: Would Putin Stop If He Wins in Ukraine? Let’s Not Find Out.

description: Moscow has for the first time ever activated its so-called price floor mechanism to shield the flow of petrodollars to its state budget from western energy sanctions.
title: Russia Uses Price Floor for First Time to Protect Government Oil Revenue From Sanctions

description: Alexey Navalny, the Russian opposition leader, will be buried Friday in Moscow amid a heavy police presence aimed at deterring protests against President Vladimir Putin.
title: Navalny to be Buried in Moscow as Police Impose Tight Security

description: Finland will complete a shift in power on Friday as Alexander Stubb is sworn in as the 13th president of the Nordic country, giving him oversight of foreign policy and national security.
title: NATO Member Finland’s President to Change as Stubb Is Sworn In

description: South Africa’s newly formed Change Starts Now party withdrew from elections scheduled to take place in May, citing the nation’s electoral laws.
title: Former FirstRand Chairman’s Political Party Withdraws From Vote

description: The UK government has privately urged Germany to provide long-range Taurus missiles to the government in Kyiv as London expressed irritation over comments made by German Chancellor Olaf Scholz about British activity in Ukraine.
title: UK Is Pushing Germany to Send Taurus Missiles to Ukraine

description: Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring
title: Five Things You Need to Know to Start Your Day: Europe

description: A public disagreement between the leaders of France and Germany arrives at the worst possible time for Ukraine
title: Macron’s Broken Relationship With Olaf Scholz Is Hurting Efforts to Defend Ukraine

description: Pro-Palestinian demonstrators nearly penetrated the security perimeter around President Joe Biden’s motorcade in San Francisco earlier this month, prompting cries for help from a White House aide and a moment of alarm for the US Secret Service.
title: Gaza Outrage Gets Personal as Protesters Target Biden and Cabinet Members

description: Jeremy Hunt wants UK retail investors to help revive the fortune of the country’s ailing stock market, which has been beset by underperformance, outflows and an exodus of companies.
title: Jeremy Hunt Turns to Retail Investors to Save the UK Market

description: Attacks on commercial shipping in the Arabian and Red Sea by pirates and Iran-backed Houthi rebels are likely to continue, according to senior Indian officials.
title: India Expects Piracy Attacks to Rise, Stretching Navy Resources

description: Left-wing disrupter George Galloway won a seat in the UK Parliament in a special election that underscored how the Israel-Hamas war has exacerbated community tensions and sowed division across British politics.
title: Galloway Wins UK Parliament Seat in Vote Dominated by Gaza War

description: Thousands of South Korean trainee doctors defied a government deadline to end their walkout in protest of a plan to increase medical school seats, risking punishment that includes arrest and a suspension of their licenses.
title: South Korean Doctors Remain Off Job in Defiance of Deadline

description: Japan’s ruling parties have failed to agree to allow exports of a next-generation fighter jet before a deadline set by Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, in a fresh blow for the premier as he seeks to build up the country’s defenses.
title: Japan Misses Kishida’s Deadline for Fighter Jet Export Decision

description: The top US diplomat in Hong Kong sounded the alarm over growing internet censorship in the city, underscoring fears China’s crackdown on freedoms is diminishing the hub’s appeal as a global finance hub.
title: US Envoy Warns Hong Kong Is Moving to China-Style Internet Curbs

description: Japan approved fresh sanctions over Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, in a bid to show a united front with other Group of Seven nations.
title: Japan Adds Sanctions Against Russia in Line with G-7 Allies

description: A senior Chinese official criticized Taiwan’s ruling party for what he said was “atrocious behavior” in the island’s fatal expulsion of a Chinese fishing boat last month, as the two governments continue to trade accusations over the incident.
title: China Ramps Up Criticism of Taiwan Over Fatal Fishing Incident

description: The Air National Guard technician accused of sharing highly classified information on a social media platform is expected to change his plea to guilty next week.
title: Accused Pentagon Classified Secrets Leaker Set to Plead Guilty

description: China’s equity investors will be watching for trading cues from policy priorities and signals about fiscal stimulus at a meeting of the country’s top officials next week.
title: A Trader’s Guide on What to Watch at China’s Policy Meeting

description: Brian Mulroney, the former Canadian prime minister who oversaw the treaty that tore down barriers to trade across North America, has died. He was 84.
title: Brian Mulroney, Who Led Canada Into Accords With US, Dies at 84

description: Prince Albert’s government, already under scrutiny for failing to clamp down on financial crime, faces a police investigation into corruption and conflicts of interest. The rest of Europe has had about enough.
title: The Monaco Royals Whose Deals Have Brought Peril to the Palace Doors
